job_tasks.phrase: Design and implement full-stack solutions for time-series anomaly detection, generative AI solutions, tabular data classification, and alert prioritization.
job_tasks.justification: This phrase describes the implementation of solutions, which is a core software development task, and specifically mentions integrating different types of models (time-series, generative AI, classification) into a broader solution.

job_tasks.phrase: working closely with our main engineering team to make these innovations come to life.
job_tasks.justification: This indicates collaboration with a core engineering team to bring developed solutions into reality, a key aspect of software integration.

job_tasks.phrase: Contribute to the product development lifecycle from conception to deployment, ensuring that solutions are scalable, efficient, and meet user needs.
job_tasks.justification: This covers the entire software development lifecycle, from initial idea to final deployment, emphasizing scalability and efficiency, which are core software engineering principles.

job_tasks.phrase: you've built data products or software intended for external users.
job_tasks.justification: This explicitly states experience in building software for end-users, a fundamental software engineering practice.

job_tasks.phrase: Close Collaboration with Software Engineers: Whether you've been an integral part of a full-stack engineering team or have a solid understanding of cross-disciplinary collaboration, your ability to work alongside front-end, back-end, and platform engineers is vital.
job_tasks.justification: This highlights the importance of working within a software engineering team, including front-end, back-end, and platform engineers, indicating a strong software development focus.

job_tasks.phrase: You're eager to dive into general software engineering projects and expand your skill set beyond AI and modeling.
job_tasks.justification: This explicitly states a willingness and expectation to engage in general software engineering tasks, reinforcing the role's software development foundation.

job_tasks.phrase: Solid experience with code versioning, continuous integration, and continuous deployment tools, like Git, Github Actions, and Pytest, is expected.
job_tasks.justification: This directly refers to CI/CD practices and tools, which fall under MLOps/DevOps for software and model deployment.

job_tasks.phrase: You know your way around code reviews and value maintaining high-quality codebases.
job_tasks.justification: Code reviews and maintaining code quality are essential parts of software development operations and MLOps.

job_tasks.phrase: Knowledge of deployment and DevOps tools like Terraform and Kubernetes is a plus.
job_tasks.justification: Explicit mention of deployment and DevOps tools like Terraform and Kubernetes clearly aligns with the Operations & MLOps category.

job_tasks.phrase: time-series modeling and anomaly detection
job_tasks.justification: This refers to specific machine learning modeling techniques, fitting the definition of model development.

job_tasks.phrase: classification of tabular data
job_tasks.justification: This describes a specific type of machine learning task (classification) applied to a data type (tabular data), fitting model development.

job_tasks.phrase: creating Generative AI applications.
job_tasks.justification: This directly refers to the development of applications using Generative AI, which involves model development and application.

job_tasks.phrase: Your ability to innovate and solve complex problems in these areas is key.
job_tasks.justification: This emphasizes problem-solving within the context of specific AI/ML areas, aligning with model development and innovation.

profile.rationale: The role requires a balanced mix of core software engineering tasks (1.A.1, 1.A.2) such as full-stack solution implementation, CI/CD, and collaboration with software engineers, and AI specialization tasks (1.B.1, 1.B.2) focusing on Generative AI applications, time-series modeling, and classification. The emphasis on building customer-facing products and integrating AI solutions into them, along with the explicit mention of 'generative AI solutions' and the need to expand skills beyond AI into general software engineering, points towards a Core GenAI Engineer profile. The role is not purely specialized in GenAI (1.B.2) as it includes traditional ML tasks and significant software engineering components, nor is it purely AI-adjacent software engineering (1.A.1) as it involves direct model development and application of GenAI. It's a blend, with a clear focus on GenAI within that blend.

confidence.reasoning: The job advertisement is very clear and detailed, explicitly mentioning both core software engineering practices (full-stack development, CI/CD, collaboration with engineers) and AI/ML specializations (time-series, classification, generative AI applications). The requirements and responsibilities align well with the definitions provided in the coding book, making the profile assignment straightforward and highly confident.
